problem.p: This numerical problem gives partial credit for an answer in kilometers rather than miles.

ul.li:
To allow closer answers, set partial_credit="close" in the numericalresponse tag.
You may specify a partial_range="#" attribute if you like, which multiplies the existing tolerance to get the expanded range. The default is 2. Non-numerical characters are dropped, so you can write "4x" instead of "4" if that helps you remember.
To give a set of alternative answers, set partial_credit="list" and create a responseparam tag with partial_answers="ans1,ans2,ans3,...".
To do both, use partial_credit="close,list" and set up the extra responseparam tag as well.

problem.p: How many miles away from Earth is the sun? Use scientific notation to answer. Numerical tolerance of 100,000.

div.p: The sun is 93,000,000, or 9.3*10^6, miles away from Earth.
